help.name: help
help.title: FailBot Command List:
help.text:
**Help Usage:**
`!help [COMMAND]` | `!h [COMMAND]`

**Dice Roller**
	`!roll` | `!r`

**Spell Lookup**
`!spell` | `!s`

**Condition Lookup**
`!condition` | `!c`

**Monster Ability Lookup**
`!monsterability` | `!m`

**Weapon Trait Lookup**
`!weapontrait` | `!w`

**Exploration Action Lookup**
	`!explorationaction` | `!e`

**Lookup List**
`!list` | `!l`

Use messages with `![Command]` formatting to interact with this bot

Use `!help` or `!h` followed by any valid command to get more detailed help on that command's usage

roll.name: roll
roll.help:
**Dice Roller:**
Roll the dice indicated by the arguments
`!roll [ARGUMENTS]` | `!r [ARGUMENTS]`

**Example:**
To roll two 20-sided dice
`!roll 2d20` | `!r 2d20`

Use `+` and `-` to join several dice rolls or constants together
`!roll 2d6+1`
`!r 1d20-4`
`!r 2d10+1d6+1`

spell.name: spell
spell.help:
**Spell Lookup:**
Search for and display the spell best matching the supplied search term
`!spell [SEARCH TERMS]` | `!s [SEARCH TERMS]`

**Example:**
To look up the spell Acid Splash
`!spell acid splash` | `!s acid splash`

Partial searches such as `!s acid` will also work but may not always return the desired result

Lookup will attempt to find the best available match using the search criteria given.
Use any reacts below the result to interact further.

condition.name: condition
condition.help:
**Condition Lookup:**
Search for and display the condition best matching the supplied search term
`!condition [SEARCH TERMS]` | `!c [SEARCH TERMS]`

**Example:**
To look up the condition Dazzled
`!condition dazzled` | `!c dazzled`

Partial searches such as `!c dazz` will also work but may not always return the desired result

Lookup will attempt to find the best available match using the search criteria given.
Use any reacts below the result to interact further.

monsterability.name: monsterability
monsterability.help:
**Monster Ability Lookup:**
Search for and display the monster ability best matching the supplied search term
`!monsterability [SEARCH TERMS]` | `!m [SEARCH TERMS]`

**Example:**
To look up the monster ability Catch Rock
`!monsterability catch rock` | `!m catch rock`

Partial searches such as `!m catch` will also work but may not always return the desired result

Lookup will attempt to find the best available match using the search criteria given.
Use any reacts below the result to interact further.

weapontrait.name: weapontrait
weapontrait.help:
**Weapon Trait Lookup:**
Search for and display the weapon trait best matching the supplied search term
`!weapontrait [SEARCH TERMS]` | `!w [SEARCH TERMS]`

**Example:**
To look up the weapon trait Finesse
`!weapontrait finesse` | `!w finesse`

Partial searches such as `!w fin` will also work but may not always return the desired result

Lookup will attempt to find the best available match using the search criteria given.
Use any reacts below the result to interact further.

exploration.name: explorationaction
exploration.help:
**Exploration Action Lookup:**
Search for and display the exploration action best matching the supplied search term
`!explorationaction [SEARCH TERMS]` | `!e [SEARCH TERMS]`

**Example:**
To look up the exploration action Detect Magic 
`!explorationaction detect magic` | `!e detect magic`

Partial searches such as `!e detect` will also work but may not always return the desired result

Lookup will attempt to find the best available match using the search criteria given.
Use any reacts below the result to interact further.

list.name: list
list.help:
**Get Command Reference List:**
Display the possible search terms for the condition, monster ability, weapon trait, or exploration action command
`!list [ARGUMENTS]` | `!l [ARGUMENTS]`

**Example:**
To retrieve a list of available weapon traits
`!list weapontraits ` | `!l weapontraits` | `!list w` | `!l w`

Partial searches will not return a result, the argument should be a full valid command

default.text:
Invalid Command
Commands must be in the following form:

`!<COMMAND> [OPTIONS]`

Type `!help` for a list of valid commands
